Class EncFSCrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • EncFSCrypt

  • public final class EncFSCrypt
extends Object
    Methods to use EncFS encryption on single files, without direct file system access.
    Author:
    Samuel Moosmann @ TripleIn software solutions GmbH

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EncFSCrypt()

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        public static final byte[] decrypt(byte[] encryptedData,
             byte[] config,
             String password)
                            throws EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                   EncFSInvalidConfigException,
                                   EncFSInvalidPasswordException,
                                   EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                   IOException
        Decrypts data using a EncFS configuration file and the password
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - Data to decrypt
        config - EncFS configuration file
        password - Password used when creating the EncFS volume
        Returns:
        Decrypted data as byte array
        Throws:
        EncFSUnsupportedException
        EncFSInvalidConfigException
        EncFSInvalidPasswordException
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        IOException

      • decrypt

        public static final oracle.sql.BLOB decrypt(oracle.sql.BLOB encryptedData,
                      oracle.sql.BLOB config,
                      String password)
                                     throws SQLException,
                                            EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                            EncFSInvalidConfigException,
                                            EncFSInvalidPasswordException,
                                            EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                            IOException
        Decrypts data using a EncFS configuration file and the password, usable in Oracle PL/SQL
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - Data to decrypt
        config - EncFS configuration file as BLOB
        password - Password used when generating the config file
        Returns:
        Decrypted data as BLOB
        Throws:
        SQLException
        EncFSUnsupportedException
        EncFSInvalidConfigException
        EncFSInvalidPasswordException
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        IOException

        public static final String[] decryptFilenames(String[] encryptedFilenames,
                        byte[] config,
                        String password)
                                       throws EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                              IOException,
                                              EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                              EncFSInvalidConfigException,
                                              EncFSInvalidPasswordException
        Decrypts an array of filenames
        Parameters:
        encryptedFilenames - Encrypted filenames
        config - EncFS configuration file
        password - Password used when creating the EncFS volume
        Returns:
        Array with the decrypted filenames
        Throws:
        EncFSCorruptDataException
        IOException
        EncFSUnsupportedException
        EncFSInvalidConfigException
        EncFSInvalidPasswordException

        Decrypted filename

        public static final byte[] generateBoxcryptorConfigFile(String newPassword)
                                                 throws EncFSUnsupportedException,
                                                        EncFSInvalidConfigException,
                                                        EncFSCorruptDataException,
                                                        EncFSInvalidPasswordException,
                                                        IOException
        Generates a EncFS configuration file, compatible with Boxcryptor Classic
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        EncFS configuration file as a byte array

        EncFSUnsupportedException
        EncFSInvalidConfigException
